results.title: An Unguarded moment
results.creator_credit: Glenn Filbin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Glenn Filbin fashions his story into a cautionary tale, where his unguarded moment became his life sentence.

results.title: Here, there & back again
results.creator_credit: Wayne Hornsby, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Wayne Hornsby was in Thailand when he was diagnosed with HIV. He reflects on his journey, nearly dying and his return to Australia, where his work in helping HIV positive people eventually leads him back to Thailand.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Hornsby, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Wayne Hornsby was in Thailand when he was diagnosed with HIV. He reflects on his journey, nearly dying and his return to Australia, where his work in helping HIV positive people eventually leads him back to Thailand.

results.title: For my true love
results.creator_credit: Russell Varney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Russell and Wendy were both diagnosed with HIV they resolved to lean on each other as they feared discrimination. Eventually they reached out to organisations like Straight Arrows and started to feel alive again.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Russell Varney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Russell and Wendy were both diagnosed with HIV they resolved to lean on each other as they feared discrimination. Eventually they reached out to organisations like Straight Arrows and started to feel alive again.

results.title: The Vale of Kashmir
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
The Vale of Kashmir has been the destination of tourists for centuries. Kashmir is renowned throughout the world for its exquisite crafts and exotic houseboats lining the shores of picturesque Dal Lake. Keith Adam looks behind the tourist facade to find the lifestyle of the real Kashmiri.

results.title: The Bakrawallahs
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
Keith Adam visits the Bakrawallas, nomadic goatherders living in the remote and beautiful peaks of Kashmir. We follow the events from announcement to ceremony of a Wedding between a groom of sixteen and a veiled bride

results.title: Bhutan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
A trip to Bhutan, the mysterious, rarely filmed kingdom nestling in the folds of the great Himalayas. Narrated by Keith Adam.

results.title: The Sherpas of Everest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
The story of Sherpa, Sirdar Ang Tsering, one of the few men ever to stand atop the summit of Everest. He is shown making a pilgrimage from his home village of Namche Bazar to the mountain which has made him famous.

Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.

results.title: Ladakh: little Tibet
results.creator_credit: Bill Steller, Chris McCullough, Stafford Garner, Ted Rayment and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
Ladakh, known as Little Tibet, lies to the North East of Kashmir. Keith Adam finds that its barren moon-like landscape provides a stark contrast to the soft, green hills of Kashmir. The capital, Leh, has been for centuries an important regional trading centre, and remains as such today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Steller, Chris McCullough, Stafford Garner, Ted Rayment and ABC

results.title: Rumtek Monastery
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner, Bill Steller, Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
Concentrates on the Buddhist Monastery at Rumtek, a small village in the tiny Himalayan kingdom of Sikkin. Explores in detail what is perhaps one of the purest remaining examples of practising Tibetan Buddhism. Narrated by Keith Adam.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stafford Garner, Bill Steller, Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
